jobs.title: CDD PERFORMANCE MARKETING SPECIALIST (PAID SOCIAL) (F/H)
jobs.description:
Poste

The Performance Marketing Specialist will play a critical role in shaping Christian Dior Couture‚Äôs Paid Social for Performance animation (mid and lower funnel) and its effectiveness. As part of the HQ team, the role will encompass all E-commerce zones and markets. The ideal candidate possesses a strong understanding of paid social platforms globally, performance measurement methodologies, combined with a product and creative sensibility. Excellent project management skills, cross-functional collaboration abilities, and a passion for data-driven insights are essential for success in this position.

Missions

1/ SOCIAL MEDIA PERFORMANCE ANIMATION & OPTMIZATON (MID & LOWER FUNNEL)

 Develop a robust lower funnel social media yearly strategy that fits each zone E-commerce & Omnichannel strategic objectives (traffic, revenue, ROAS, client recruitment, drive to store, etc.) including budget recommendations, platforms guidelines, audience strategy and overall operational process & best practices. Contribute to the construction of the global yearly and quarterly Social Media campaigns timeline for seasonal collection launches and key commercial events, in close collaboration with the central Social Media and Media teams to ensure a seamless and cohesive Social Media presence across all stages of the funnel. Work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure a coherent animation within paid acquisition channels and to the website. Work closely with regional teams to collect their local business requirements and use market-specific insights to ensure they tailor their strategy accordingly. Stay ahead of industry trends for each major Social Media platform and emerging platforms, including the players specific to China and APAC markets, but also consumer behaviors to keep the brand‚Äôs digital marketing strategies innovative and competitive.

2/ PAID SOCIAL PERFORMANCE

 Analyze the weekly and compile monthly analysis on Paid Social lower funnel performances across regions to share actionable recommendations.Paid Social animation performances by campaign and zoneTo compare with LY performances (same collection launch or markeing momentum) and yearly zone benchmarks, identifying key results, possible optimizations and zone best practices to test or roll-out in other markets Identify points of attention, tailored recommendations and dedicated follow ups by zone and across all main platforms (Meta, Snapchat, Kakao, WeChat, Red, JD, TikTok, Pinterest). Accountability of performance KPIs monitoring by platform at campaign level:Budget, CPA, CTR, Revenue, ROAS as well as key learnings for future strategy planning

3/ GLOBAL AUDIENCE PLANNING MANAGEMENT

 Develop strategies to further leverage first-party data to enhance client and prospect targeting and personalization in lower funnel campaigns. Ensure availability of audience segments based on customer data and behavior to improve the effectiveness of media spending. Work with the Data Factory team to ensure seamless integration of customer data into media buying platforms. Use data to inform media planning, targeting, and creative decisions, ensuring campaigns are data-driven and customer-centric.

Profil

 Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, Statistics, or a related field. 5+ years of experience in digital media, or paid social. Good understanding of other digital media channels, including paid search, social media, display advertising, and email marketing. Excellent project management skills and proficiency in data analysis, including the ability to develop and manage animation plans, timelines, and budgets. Strong communication and presentation skills. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Well-organized and detail oriented.

Temporary Contract - From ASAP to the End of April 2026

Information √† l'attention des candidats

Encouraging diversity in all its forms, Christian Dior Couture has been committed since 2013 to an approach in favour of the employment of people with disabilities.

jobs.title: Language Expert
jobs.description:
Crossing Hurdles is a recruitment firm. We refer top candidates to our partners working with the world‚Äôs leading AI research labs to help build and train cutting-edge AI models.
Position: Language Expert ‚Äì PhDsType: Hourly ContractCompensation: $80/hour (based on experience & location)Location: RemoteDuration: 3‚Äì4 weeks (short-term project, with possible extension)Commitment: 15‚Äì40 hours/week (flexible, asynchronous)
Role Responsibilities (Training support will be provided)Create and complete linguistic evaluation tasks to benchmark AI language models.Draft language-based tasks and provide answer keys, rationales, and explanations.Ensure cultural, contextual, and grammatical accuracy in all evaluations.Distinguish subtle differences in tone, register, formality, and appropriateness.Work independently and asynchronously while collaborating with research teams as needed.
RequirementsNative speaker of one of the target languages.PhD strongly preferred (Linguistics, Literature, Cultural Studies, or related fields).Strong command of grammar, tone, semantics, and cultural nuances.Experience in language teaching, assessment, exam design, or linguistic evaluation preferred.Excellent attention to detail and ability to provide clear, structured feedback.Access to a desktop or laptop computer (Chromebooks not supported).
P.S. - Accept the invite pop-up during the application process so we can keep you posted and help you with any issues or questions.

jobs.title: SEO Consultant - [Opening soon]
jobs.description:
Botify‚Äôs leading agentic AI search technology and seasoned experts ensure every brand has the power to be found, both in traditional and AI search. With one powerful platform, brands achieve visibility, relevance, and greater control across Google, Bing, ChatGPT, Perplexity, and more.

Botify‚Äôs technology powers agentic workflows, AI-driven recommendations, and automated cross-platform indexation and deployment. Brands maximize visibility wherever consumers, bots, and AI agents search, protecting and capturing revenue across all search platforms.

Trusted by 500+ leading brands including Macy‚Äôs, Levi‚Äôs, Farfetch, the New York Times, and Marks & Spencer, Botify drives digital discovery, sustained profitability, productivity, and brand authority in an AI-first world.

Industry research shows that women and those in traditionally underrepresented groups generally don't apply to jobs unless they check all the boxes for the role. If you feel strongly that you have what it takes for this role but don't check 100% of the boxes - that's okay - we encourage you to apply anyway and highlight what you can bring to the table!

Role Overview

At Botify, we‚Äôre redefining SEO consulting by combining cutting-edge technology, a culture of innovation, and the brightest minds in the industry. As an SEO Consultant, you will play a pivotal role in solving our customers‚Äô most complex SEO challenges while delivering measurable business outcomes. You‚Äôll work hand-in-hand with industry-leading brands and collaborate with a world-class consulting team that‚Äôs passionate about pushing boundaries.

You Are...

We‚Äôre Looking For Someone Whose Passion For SEO Runs Deep. You Thrive In Complexity And Love Breaking Down Challenges Into Actionable Solutions. Specifically, You Are

A Technical Problem Solver: You get excited about diagnosing crawl issues, debugging JavaScript SEO problems, or creating innovative solutions to complex site architectures.Proactive: You take initiative to find answers‚Äîyou're always a step ahead, researching, analyzing, and proposing solutions.Collaborative: You know how to bring people together, from developers to marketing teams, to get things done and drive results.Customer-Obsessed: You genuinely care about your clients' success and go above and beyond to make them win.Curious and Geeky: You get excited about the latest SEO trends, emerging technologies, and industry innovations.

We Are...

We are growing our consulting team of SEO leaders that work with some of the world‚Äôs largest and most influential brands to solve their most challenging SEO problems.

Hands-On Problem Solvers: We work directly with customers, applying our unique technology and expertise to deliver solutions tailored to their needs.Innovators: We embrace challenges, love to experiment, and define new standards in SEO consulting.A Team of Experts: Our team includes some of the brightest minds in SEO, and we thrive on collaboration and knowledge-sharing.At the Cutting Edge: Botify technology leads the industry in harnessing AI and automation to drive SEO performance, and we are at the forefront of innovation in this space.

Your Responsibilities

As an SEO Consultant at Botify, you‚Äôll manage a portfolio of long-term client engagements and occasional project-based consulting engagements. You will:

Build and maintain strong client relationships, serving as the primary point of contact.Lead ongoing meetings with clients to review progress, troubleshoot challenges, and present strategic recommendations.Develop and execute SEO roadmaps that align with client goals and ensure consistent progress.Conduct in-depth technical SEO audits, identifying issues and proposing solutions to improve site performance.Write and manage SEO tickets for client teams, ensuring clear and actionable implementation steps.Manage SEO aspects of complex site migrations communicating with various stakeholders including teams within the customers‚Äô organization, agencies, e-commerce vendors, and other specialist third parties.Support customers in interpreting data and deriving insights; guide them on the design of custom reporting solutions to be developed in collaboration with the Professional Services team.Assist clients with technical implementations, providing QA and guidance on staging environments to ensure accuracy.Leverage Botify‚Äôs PageWorkers product to craft and implement optimizations directly on client sites.Drive engagements forward by proactively identifying opportunities and spearheading initiatives to solve clients' most pressing SEO problems.

Your Qualifications

To succeed in this role, you should have:

7+ years of professional SEO experience, including a focus on technical SEO.3+ years of client-facing experience, managing long-term engagements and working with cross-functional teams.Proven ability to conduct technical SEO audits and deliver actionable strategies.Experience QAing SEO implementations in staging environments and live sites.Expertise in designing and implementing technical SEO solutions, including site migrations, site architecture, and structured data.Hands-on experience optimizing content within CMS platforms or guiding teams to do so.Familiarity with leveraging AI platforms to streamline workflows and improve efficiency.Exceptional communication skills, with the ability to distill complex technical concepts into simple, actionable recommendations for both technical and non-technical audiences.A team-oriented mindset and a passion for solving the biggest challenges in SEO.

Why Botify?

When you join Botify, you‚Äôre joining the brightest SEOs in the business, working with some of the biggest companies in the world to solve the most challenging problems in the industry.

Our Technology: One-of-a-kind, AI-driven, and continually innovating to lead the SEO industry.Our Culture: Collaborative, supportive, and dynamic, with a focus on continuous learning and growth.Our Impact: We don‚Äôt just optimize for rankings; we create measurable business outcomes that transform the way companies approach SEO.

If you‚Äôre ready to redefine what‚Äôs possible in SEO and thrive in a team of experts who love what they do, we‚Äôd love to hear from you.

Hiring Process

30 minutes with the Talent Acquisition team45 minutes with our Head of Consulting Services45 minutes with a member of our Consulting Services team1-hour presentation with the SVP of Global Services and the Consulting Services team

What We Offer

To keep our employees happy and motivated, we are always assessing the benefits/perks we offer to ensure we are competitive. Here are some we‚Äôd like to highlight:

Location: brand new offices in the center of Paris (12 rue d‚ÄôAmsterdam, straight out of Gare Saint-Lazare)Hybrid remote policyAttractive Remuneration Package with BSPCE (for Permanent full-time role - CDI)Fun office culture & regular outings such as Team Off-Sites, Annual Kick-Off, Quaterly Team Lunch, Thirsty Thursdays etc. Lunch vouchers, 50% of transportation reimbursement, fitness classes, generous CSE advantages etc. Compelling growth perspectives 

Start date: as soon as possible

In addition to the skills and experience we are looking for, our ideal candidate would embody our core values:

Empower Customers. Unleash Potential.

Learn Fast. Progress Faster.

Go the Extra Mile. It‚Äôs Never Crowded.

Work Hard. Stay Humble.

Be Bold. Be You.

Botify is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, colour, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.

We're eager to add talent to our growing team, across departments and around the globe. Scout our open roles for your next opportunity.

jobs.title: Ecommerce Account Manager(A46233)
jobs.description:
Responsibilities:Sales Performance Management : Oversee and enhance online sales performance by optimizing product listings, pricing, and inventory to boost overall digital business performance.Ecommerce Project Management : Manage projects related to ecommerce, including but not limited to sales, performance marketing, CRM and product launches.Advertising and Marketing Optimization : Manage and refine online advertising strategies to boost key performance indicators such as traffic and conversion rates.Business Analysis and Growth : Conduct regular business reviews to analyze sales performance and identify potential areas for growth and expansion on ecommerce platforms.Cross-functional Collaboration : Collaborate with GTM, marketing, and logistics teams to ensure seamless and efficient operations.Industry Trend Monitoring : Stay updated on industry trends, ecommerce technologies, and best practices to ensure our platforms remain competitive and innovative.

jobs.title: Head of User Acquisition - Apps
jobs.description:
About Voodoo

Founded in 2013, Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps with a mission to entertain the world. Gathering 800 employees, 7 billion downloads, and over 200 million active users, Voodoo is the #3 mobile publisher worldwide in terms of downloads after Google and Meta. Our portfolio includes chart-topping games like Mob Control and Block Jam, alongside popular apps such as BeReal and Wizz.

Team

Our Growth team helps maximize the potential of each Voodoo product within the ecosystem. Our Growth team is split into several job expertise such as user acquisition, ad monetization, video ads, playable ads, and influencer marketers. Being part of the Growth Team at Voodoo requires a lot of operational excellence and creativity in order to constantly adapt ourselves to stay ahead of the rest of the market.

Role

As the Head of UA - Consumer Apps, you will be responsible for scaling our portfolio of social apps worldwide, with a specific focus on BeReal and Wizz.

You will lead and build a team of 10+ people to cover paid and organic growth, while reporting to the Head of Growth / VP Growth and working closely with our CEO.

The ideal candidate is a data-driven growth leader with a structured mindset, a passion for growth hacking, and the ability to thrive in a dynamic and entrepreneurial environment.

Build the growth strategy to scale our top mobile apps such as Wizz or BeRealExecute our growth acquisition channels, including paid UA, partnerships, featuring deals, app store relationships, cross-promotion, PR, influencer marketing, growth hacking, ASO and community building.Stay up-to-date with industry trends and competitors‚Äô growth strategies to identify the last performing channels we can activate.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure smooth execution of the growth strategy, building strong partnerships and leverage resources effectively.Conduct systematic data analysis and leverage key metrics to measure channels performances, drive decision-making, prioritize growth initiatives and identify improvement opportunities.

Profile

You have at least 4-8 years of experience in scaling apps, mobile preferablyYou have already managed a team of at least 5 peopleYou show strong interest and knowledge of the mobile apps industryYou understand the mobile growth ecosystem in detail (Privacy, MMP, etc.) as well as branding performance You are a data-driven, growth hacker with a structured mindsetYou have entrepreneurial mindset and can adapt to a high-paced environmentYou can demonstrate excellent teamwork and collaboration skillsYou are fluent in English (fluency in French is a plus)

Benefits

Competitive salary upon experienceSwile restaurant lunch voucherGymlib sports subscription (100% taken in charge by us)Sidecare healthcare coverage for your familyChild day care facilities (Les Petits Chaperons rouge)Wellness activities in our Paris officeCreative hackathonUnlimited vacation policyFull stack desk and computer equipment upon your requestCooperate within a globally diverse team and a rich cross-cultural work environment

jobs.title: Consultant, Digital Strategy
jobs.description:
Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures‚Äîand business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

Practice Area

BCG‚Äôs Tech and Digital practice area focuses on helping clients deliver competitive advantage and business superior performance through the use of data, technology and digital. Tech and Digital is the fastest growing practice at BCG and at the heart of the strategic impact we have with our clients. Our consultants and experts globally work across all industries and provide deep experience and expertise across a number of topics including Digital Transformation, Data & Digital Platforms, AI at Scale, Agile, Cybersecurity and Digitizing the Tech Function. Our Tech and Digital offer encompasses tech experts across BCG and Platinion, providing seamless multidisciplinary solutions to our clients.

What You'll Do

Our world is being driven by digital and at BCG we are at the heart of it. In DigitalBCG, you would use your expertise and generalist consulting skillset to help CEOs and their teams solve their most pressing challenges, and think about how digital and technology will change the shape of their business.You would help your clients answer questions such as 'How will AI disrupt my business model?', 'How can businesses use data and analytics to create highly-personalized outreach delivered through a seamless omnichannel experience?', 'How can I ship higher quality digital services to my customers faster by using agile?' and much more.As a member of our team, you would work on a variety of these topics, applying your consulting skills to strategic digital, technology, and digital transformation questions.As a DigitalBCG Consultant, you will be given end-to-end responsibility for the larger and more complex 'modules' within a BCG project, and begin to develop specialized knowledge to help you solve our clients' problems. You'll work closely with clients to understand their issues, create strategies for change, win buy-in for your recommendations, and collaborate with fellow BCGers to transform client potential into performance.A broad skillset and passion for digital & technology is important. As part of our digitally-focused consulting team, you would work on a variety of digital topics, applying generalist consulting skills to strategic digital & technology questions. You will be supported by an extensive training curriculum (the same programme as all BCG consultants), plus digital-specific training and mentoring to help you build your skills.

What You'll Bring

We're looking for exceptional talent from consulting or industry to join us. You would typically:

Have 4-6 years' of experience working:with a leading consulting firm (focused on technology/digital initiatives)in a corporate role focused on technology/digital initiatives (e.g. business analyst)in a tech start-up leadership role or in a 'consulting-like' industry (e.g. digital strategy, digital marketing)Have an outstanding academic track record from a leading universityHave excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
Who You'll Work With

Who You'll Work With:Our consultants within DigitalBCG are an integral part of BCG's core consulting team; we work side-by-side with all practice areas to create value & competitive advantage for our clients

Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.

BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here  for more information on E-Verify.

Contribuer √† l‚Äô√©ditorialisation du catalogue culturelImaginer des dispositifs pour mettre en avant la diversit√© des offres culturelles, en collaboration avec des √©quipes vari√©es.Participer aux chantiers li√©s √† la homepage, √† la d√©couvrabilit√© dans l‚Äôapp, et √† l‚Äôenrichissement du catalogue.Produire des synth√®ses √† destination des partenaires culturels pour rendre compte de l‚Äôimpact de leurs actions.
Animer l‚Äô√©cosyst√®me professionnelAccompagner les √©quipes B2B (produit, d√©veloppement‚Ä¶) dans la valorisation du pass Culture aupr√®s des acteurs culturels, √©tablissements scolaires, collectivit√©s, etc.Travailler de fa√ßon conjointe avec les √©quipes des √©tudes et de la communication institutionnelle afin de partager les connaissances du pass CulturePiloter la strat√©gie de contenus √† destination de l‚Äô√©cosyst√®me professionnel
Suivre la performance et assurer le reportingSuivre les KPIs des actions marketing et √©ditoriales et en faire un reporting r√©gulier √† la Direction, au minist√®re et aux partenaires.Produire des bilans sp√©cifiques (campagnes, audiences, r√©tention, usages‚Ä¶) √† destination des parties prenantes internes et externes.Ajuster les strat√©gies et outils en fonction des r√©sultats observ√©s et des retours terrain 
Profil recherch√©
Au moins 7 ans d‚Äôexp√©rience en marketing digital B2B et B2C, incluant une solide exp√©rience manag√©riale.Bonne connaissance des institutions culturelles ; id√©alement au moins une exp√©rience pass√©e au sein d‚Äôun d√©partement marketing (ou similaire) dans une institution publique ou culturelle.Go√ªt pour l‚Äô√©ditorial, capacit√© √† d√©fendre une ligne de communication coh√©rente, √† piloter des campagnes multi-canales et √† d√©velopper de nouveaux formats.Solide ma√Ætrise des outils marketing (CRM, analytics‚Ä¶) et des logiques d‚Äôacquisition et de r√©tention (B2C comme B2B).Expertise av√©r√©e dans le lancement et l‚Äôoptimisation de campagnes digitales payantes, de pr√©f√©rence √† destination d‚Äôaudiences B2CExp√©rience dans un environnement num√©rique ou ¬´ produit ¬ª (start-up, application, projet SaaS ou plateforme web), et capacit√© √† collaborer avec des profils techniques.Tr√®s bonnes comp√©tences en coordination transverse et en pilotage de projets complexes impliquant plusieurs directions.Excellente culture de la donn√©e : √† l‚Äôaise avec les KPIs, les dashboards, les outils d‚Äôanalyse.Sensibilit√© au secteur culturel, √† la jeunesse et aux probl√©matiques du service public.

jobs.title: Computational Biologist
jobs.description:
Research scientist: computational biology Full time employee positionLocation: Paris (offices in Biolabs, 75014) ‚Äì hybrid/remote-friendly
About One BiosciencesOne Biosciences is a precision diagnostics company decoding tumor heterogeneity through single-cell transcriptomics and AI. Our proprietary platform combines advanced biological protocols and algorithms to deliver clinical-grade insights that guide cancer treatment. We collaborate with Institut Curie, Gustave Roussy, and other leading centers, and following our ‚Ç¨15M Series A, we are expanding internationally. Join us to bring the next generation of precision diagnostics to oncologists worldwide.
Your MissionAs Research Scientist in Computational Biology, you will bridge biology and data science to decode tumor heterogeneity. Working with clinicians, biologists, and AI experts, you will design analytical pipelines, mine large single-cell RNA-seq datasets, and develop biomarkers that directly impact treatment decision. Your work will power our core platform and directly shape the diagnostics of tomorrow.
What You‚Äôll Do¬∑ Analyze and integrate large-scale genomic and single-cell data.¬∑ Develop and apply algorithms, statistical models, and visualizations.¬∑ Identify biomarkers of treatment response and support hypothesis generation.¬∑ Collaborate with academic and pharma partners in France and the US.
What We‚Äôre Looking For¬∑ PhD in computational biology (or related field).¬∑ Track record of academic collaborations and publications.¬∑ Strong coding skills (R, Python) and experience in genomics or single-cell analysis.¬∑ Solid background in data mining and statistics.¬∑ Experience with ML or cloud computing (AWS) is a plus.¬∑ Ability to communicate effectively with biologists and clinicians.
Why Join Us?¬∑ Work with cutting-edge single-cell datasets and real clinical impact.¬∑ Collaborate with leading cancer centers in France and the US.¬∑ Join a fast-growing company scaling globally.¬∑ Competitive package (salary + performance bonus).
Process1. Use case test 2. Interviews with scientific leads Contact: Contact@onebiosciences.fr

jobs.title: Content Writer
jobs.description:
Innodata (NASDAQ: INOD) is a leading data engineering company. With more than 2,000 customers and operations in 13 cities around the world, we are an AI technology solutions provider-of-choice for 4 out of 5 of the world‚Äôs biggest technology companies, as well as leading companies across financial services, insurance, technology, law, and medicine.By combining advanced machine learning and artificial intelligence (ML/AI) technologies, a global workforce of subject matter experts, and a high-security infrastructure, we‚Äôre helping usher in the promise of AI. Innodata offers a powerful combination of both digital data solutions and easy-to-use, high-quality platforms.
Our global workforce includes over 5,000 employees in the United States, Canada, United Kingdom, the Philippines, India, Sri Lanka, Israel and Germany.
About the role:
We are seeking a highly analytical and detail-oriented linguist to support AI training initiatives and linguistic content creation. This role is ideal for someone with a strong academic background in linguistics (syntax, semantics, pragmatics, morphology, phonology, sociolinguistics, etc.) and a passion for language, technology, and clear communication. You will play a crucial role in shaping the capabilities of large language models (LLMs) and NLP-based systems through high-quality linguistic data curation, annotation, and evaluation.
Job Title: Linguistics Expert ‚Äì AI Training & Content Writing

Key Responsibilities:
Create or edit linguistically- rich content including grammar guides, syntactic analyses, usage explanations, or examples for NLP pipelines.Identify and resolve issues related to ambiguity, bias, and grammaticality.Perform quality assurance (QA) on model outputs for fluency, tone, factual accuracy, and language appropriateness.Annotate linguistic datasets with syntactic, semantic, or pragmatic labels.Support internal teams by conducting linguistic research and summarizing findings.Apply linguistic knowledge to evaluate model behavior, error patterns, and generalization issues.
Qualifications:Deep understanding of linguistic theory and language structure.Experience with one or more of the following is a plus: computational linguistics, corpus analysis, language data annotation, LLM training.Strong writing, editing, and communication skills.
Next StepsTo proceed further in the evaluation process, you will need to complete two assessments:Assessment TestEvaluates your linguistic and analytical skillsLink: https://icap.innodata.com/registerfreelancer?enc=oUTZVsr/Pnz/0Xygc2EK32MdtinqnjC9vy8RU3Ha4EOAPwT2LJJQDD68MkY6jszYhhsYYecqmKWja8eKXV801gezikielezikiel

Versant English Proficiency TestFocuses on assessing your spoken and written English proficiencyA C1 or C2 level is required to qualify
Once both assessments are successfully completed, you will be eligible for onboarding.Arabic Language test
Action Required: XConnect RegistrationYou will also receive an invitation to our internal job platform, XConnect. Please take a few minutes to register and complete your profile. All project onboarding, communication, and documentation are managed through this platform.
If interested, kindly share your resume at: rranjan2@innodata.com

jobs.title: Operations Specialist ‚Äì Marketplace
jobs.description:
We‚Äôre looking for an analytical and solutions-driven Operations Specialist with excellent leadership and interpersonal skills to help us grow our ride-hailing operations in France. The Operations Specialist will play a pivotal role within the Marketplace Team at Bolt, supporting various aspects of our marketplace operations.

Please note that this is a full-time permanent employment opportunity.

About Us

Bolt is one of the fastest-growing tech companies in Europe and Africa, with over 100 million customers in 45+ countries. We‚Äôre a global team of more than 100 nationalities joined on a common mission ‚Äì to make cities for people, not cars. And we need you to make it happen!

About The Role

As an Operations Specialist you will have a direct and tangible impact on local operations that you can see in real-time. If you‚Äôre ready to take full ownership of your work, disrupt the marketplace, and shape movement patterns in the urban landscape - here‚Äôs your chance!

You will be leading local operations projects and working closely with other cross-functional/HQ stakeholders to support our mission to make cities more sustainable, accessible and affordable.

Your daily adventures will include:

Conducting performance audits across our marketplace in various cities.Formulating actionable recommendations to enhance marketplace performance.Analyzing pricing strategies and suggesting price adjustments as needed.Collaborating closely with central teams to implement demand and supply campaigns effectively.Providing analytical and data support to city managers to facilitate informed decision-making..


About you:

Strong analytical skills paired with a relentless curiosity, willing to delve deep into data to identify root causes.You are a strong leader and collaborator with excellent negotiation and communication skills (both verbal and written) in English and French.Organized and methodical approach to problem-solving within our marketplace.Pragmatic mindset, prioritizing effective solutions over unnecessarily complex ones.Collaborative team player, capable of working efficiently with diverse stakeholders.Proficiency in SQL and automation is a big plus.

Job type: Contract

Contract Length:12 months

Rate: ‚Ç¨500+ per day (depending on experience)

Role Location: Must be based in the EU and be French speaking (remote working)

The company: A leading SaaS Fintech organisation based globally..

Role and Responsibilities: We are hiring for an experienced Programme Manager on a digital transformation programme for a SaaS fintech organisation looking to expand their product offering. We are looking for someone to engage with external customers to integrate products into business applications.

Job Requirements

8+ years Programme managment experience Strong internal and external stakeholder management experience Waterfall methodologies French speaking Some understanding of the financial services industry. Remote working, with occasional client travel (expensed)

Our Commitment To Diversity, Equity, And Inclusion

jobs.title: Search Engine Optimization Team Lead
jobs.description:
At Six Values, we are more than just a B2B betting and gaming technology company ‚Äî we are creators of experiences that change people‚Äôs moods for the better.We work with a range of global client brands - are we are in ‚Äúscale up‚Äù mode, hiring the best and most highly motivated, fast working, bureaucracy hating, ‚ÄúI want to win but I‚Äôm not afraid to fail‚Ä¶‚Äù, team players. We provide B2B support services to multiple technology and gaming partners, we believe in the free market, and want to hear from the best of the best.
ROLE SUMMARY:The SEO Team Lead will be responsible for owning and executing the organic search strategy across multiple B2C online casino brands. Reporting directly to the Head of SEO, this individual will manage a team of SEO specialists, collaborate cross-functionally with content, product, design, and development teams, and ensure all websites achieve strong organic visibility, traffic growth, and sustainable rankings in highly competitive iGaming markets.
The ideal candidate is both strategic and hands-on ‚Äî with deep knowledge of technical SEO, on page SEO, off page SEO and SERP performance optimization across multilingual and multi-regional casino domains.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:Strategy & ExecutionExecute SEO strategies tailored to individual casino brands across target geosOversee keyword research, competitor analysis, and content gap identificationCreate and drive content strategies for acquisition, retention, and long-tail traffic growthOwn the on-page, off-page, and technical SEO roadmaTechnical SEOManage site audits and technical health monitoring (crawlability, indexation, Core Web Vitals,etc.)Work closely with the Tech Team on site migrations, page speed, mobile-first indexing, structured data, etc.Oversee technical SEO implementation across CMSs and custom platformsTeam & Stakeholder ManagementLead and mentor a team of SEO executives/specialistsCollaborate with content, design, dev, CRM, and paid media teams for integrated campaignsProvide regular performance reporting to senior leadership with clear insights and actionsPerformance MonitoringMonitor rankings, traffic, crawl stats, and SERP features using tools like GSC, GA4, Ahrefs, and SEMrushTrack and analyze KPIs: organic sessions, conversions, rankings, link growth, and content performanceEnsure ongoing SEO compliance with regulatory and jurisdictional requirementsSEO for iGamingImplement SEO best practices with consideration for responsible gaming and regulatory requirementsMonitor for algorithm updates, penalties, and prepare defensive/offensive strategies accordingly
SKILLS & EXPERIENCE:Must-Have Skills:Proven experience in SEO leadership roles within iGaming, online casino, sportsbook, or related nichesDeep understanding of technical SEO (JavaScript SEO, schema, CWV, crawl budgets)Strong content strategy knowledge (keyword clustering, topical authority, SERP intent optimization)Hands-on experience with tools: Google Search Console, GA4, Ahrefs, SEMrush, Screaming Frog, Sitebulb, Looker/Data StudioLeadership & Communication2‚Äì5 years of experience managing SEO teams and/or cross-functional projectsStrong project management skills and ability to prioritize tasks across brands and marketsExcellent communication skills to work with devs, SEOs, native writers, and other executives.Industry & Market KnowledgeDeep familiarity with SEO in regulated markets (UKGC, MGA, Curacao, etc.)Experience managing multilingual and geo-targeted sites (hreflang, geo-IP,ccTLDs/subfolders)Understanding of affiliate SEO, bonus strategy content, and SERP monetization methodsBonus SkillsFamiliarity with server-side rendering (SSR), headless CMS environments, or CDNsKnowledge of AI tools for content and SEO productivityData literacy ‚Äì ability to analyze large datasets and extract actionable insights
OTHER:You are detail focused but able to see the ‚Äúbig picture‚Äù, you can remove barriers, and move forward at pace.Encourages communication and collaboration across the business, team and stakeholders in order to build strong relationships and develop cross functional working. A trusted advisor who always delivers on promises.Work independently, take appropriate responsibility for actions and make sensible decisions.Be self motivated as you will encounter many challenges and opportunities.
WHY JOIN US:Be part of a fast-growing, innovative company with a clear vision and mission.Work in a dynamic, collaborative environment that values speed, clarity, and decisiveness.Take ownership of a critical role with the opportunity to make a significant impact on the business.Join a team of highly motivated, talented professionals who are passionate about delivering exceptional experiences.
About sixvaluesOur vision is to elevate the mood of people everywhere, making every interaction more engaging, rewarding, and memorable. Through cutting-edge technology and a real commitment to excellence, we aim to revolutionize how people connect with digital experiences, transforming the world of betting and gaming technology.Our mission is simple yet ambitious: to be a fast-moving, highly efficient tech company that brings joy and excitement to players by delivering top-tier solutions for operators. From website and application development to data analytics and payment systems, everything we do is designed to create seamless, thrilling experiences for our partners and their customers.

jobs.title: Spontaneous Application
jobs.description:
OUR STORY:

üá™üá∫ Join Scaleway and shape the sovereign cloud of tomorrow !

Since 1999, we have been designing secure, sustainable infrastructures aimed at supporting the most ambitious companies.

Historically known for our dedicated servers (Dedibox), we made a strategic shift to cloud computing in 2015. Staying true to our principles of simplicity, flexibility, and technical excellence, we have become one of the leading players in Europe in the sector.

With the rise of artificial intelligence, we have strengthened our commitment, supported by the Iliad Group, which is investing ‚Ç¨3 billion to develop a serious, sovereign AI alternative to American and Asian giants.

Every day, thanks to our rich catalog of products and services (bare metal, containerization, serverless, AI, etc.), Scaleway proudly serves 38,000 private and public sector clients, from Photoroom to Mistral AI, Golem AI, and ADEME.

üìç Our offices are located in Paris, Lille, Toulouse, Bordeaux, Rouen, Rennes and Lyon.

At Scaleway, we are committed to building an inclusive and respectful workplace where everyone has a fair opportunity to thrive.

All applications are considered with care, regardless of age, gender, sexual orientation, ethnic or social background, religion, disability, or any other characteristic.

We believe great ideas come from everywhere, and everyone which is why you should definitely apply.

jobs.title: Creator.Group.Jobs: Sr. Online Marketing Manager/ Sr. Copywriter - English speaking at Pressmaster.ai
jobs.description:
Pressmaster.ai seeks a passionate and committed Sr. Online Marketing Manager/ Sr. Copywriter (m/w/d) - English speaking for our new start-up Pressmaster.ai, as part of the Creator Group.
Pressmaster.ai helps business owners and agencies turn expertise into engaging content across multiple platforms. Through a simple 5-minute AI interview, the platform creates weeks of authentic articles, social posts, and press releases that maintain their unique voice and industry authority.
Key features include trend alerts from 500k+ daily sources, automated content distribution to social media and blogs, custom blog creation, detailed analytics, and white-label solutions for agencies. The result? Consistent, high-quality content that builds credibility - without spending hours writing.
Join our team at Pressmaster.ai and craft sales-psychologically effective copy that amplifies our brand and transforms the PR landscape.
As a Sr. Online Marketing Manager/ Sr. Copywriter (m/w/d), you‚Äôll collaborate with a creative, forward-thinking team, leveraging your expertise to deliver compelling messaging across multiple media channels. Your work will play a pivotal role in Project management and communicating our vision and driving the success of Pressmaster.ai.
Become a key player in shaping the future of PR with innovative ideas and impactful storytelling that resonate with global audiences.
Primary focus: Direct response (online marketing) copywriting for the B2B SaaS market
Key Responsibilities:Take the lead in crafting high-converting direct response copy tailored to the B2B SaaS audience, including emails, landing pages, ad copy / creatives, and product messaging.Drive all copywriting efforts across digital channels, ensuring every word is optimized for engagement, clarity, and conversion while maintaining brand consistency.Strategize and execute full-funnel digital campaigns‚Äîpaid, organic, and email‚Äîwith compelling copy as the core driver of results.Lead content ideation and messaging strategy in alignment with product positioning, user needs, and market trends within the SaaS space.Collaborate with all departments of a marketing team, such as funnelbuilder, graphic designer, video cutters and product developers to ensure copy and creative work in unison across campaigns.Own and optimize SEO and SEM copy, from metadata and blog headlines to ad variants and performance landing pages.Analyze performance of marketing assets (open rates, CTR, CVR) and iterate copy based on data and testing.Mentor junior writers and content creators, reviewing and refining their work to uphold high standards of clarity, persuasion, and relevance.Recommend innovations in tone, storytelling, or channel strategy to improve user engagement and conversion paths.
Requirements:5‚Äì7 years of hands-on experience in direct response copywriting, with a strong portfolio focused on B2B SaaS, demonstrating measurable results (lead generation, sign-ups, conversions).Native-level English (C2) with the ability to simplify complex SaaS concepts into clear, benefit-driven messaging.Proven ability to lead content-driven digital campaigns across channels like LinkedIn Ads, Google Ads, email sequences, landing pages, and social.Deep understanding of the B2B buyer journey and how to craft copy for different funnel stages (awareness, consideration, decision).Familiarity with SaaS product marketing, value proposition frameworks, and user pain points.Skilled in tools like HubSpot, Marketo, or Pardot, as well as Google Analytics, SEMrush, and WordPress.High stress resilience and the ability to manage tight deadlines and shifting priorities while delivering exceptional results.Strong organizational and communication skills, with a collaborative mindset and attention to detail.Relevant certifications (e.g., Copyhackers, HubSpot Content Marketing, Google Ads) are a plus.
Why you‚Äôll love working with us at Pressmaster.ai?Join a dynamic team dedicated to revolutionizing the PR industry. At Pressmaster.ai, you‚Äôll help shape the future of SaaS and empower businesses worldwide to craft compelling press stories that leave a lasting impact.Thrive in a cutting-edge workspace where creativity, innovation, and AI-powered solutions drive meaningful results.Collaborate closely with seasoned professionals in PR, SaaS, and marketing. Expand your expertise with access to premium training resources and hands-on mentorship opportunities.Work on a variety of high-impact initiatives that challenge your creativity and showcase your skills in the ever-evolving world of PR and tech.We‚Äôre invested in your success. Take advantage of tailored development plans, ongoing training, and a clear path for career advancement.Leverage the latest AI-driven technologies, including our signature all-in-one PR software, to deliver exceptional results effortlessly.Enjoy the freedom of remote work, flexible hours, and a supportive company culture that prioritizes your well-being and work-life balance.We recognize your contributions with a competitive salary, performance bonuses, and comprehensive benefits.
What awaits you at Pressmaster.ai?Experience the ultimate in flexibility. Work remotely, set your own schedule, and enjoy the trust and autonomy to do your best work.Take ownership of your projects, unleash your creativity, and see your ideas transform the PR landscape. At Pressmaster.ai, we welcome innovation and bold solutions.Remote doesn‚Äôt mean disconnected. We value team spirit and foster connection through regular virtual meetings, brainstorming sessions, and social events.Your growth matters to us. Access our curated learning resources, courses, and workshops to continually enhance your skills and expertise.Be part of a vibrant and supportive company culture that values collaboration, celebrates successes, and keeps things fun with engaging virtual activities.Your aspirations drive us. We provide clear paths for growth, helping you achieve your professional goals and unlock new opportunities.Contribute to groundbreaking projects that combine creativity, technology, and PR excellence, all while shaping the future of communication.
Ready to join a passionate team and use your copywriting skills to make a lasting impact in PR and marketing?
Apply now and start your journey with us!

Join our team at Pressmaster.ai and craft sales-psychologically effective copy that amplifies our brand and transforms the PR landscape.
As a Sr. Online Marketing Manager/ Sr. Copywriter (m/w/d), you‚Äôll collaborate with a creative, forward-thinking team, leveraging your expertise to deliver compelling messaging across multiple media channels. Your work will play a pivotal role in Project management and communicating our vision and driving the success of Pressmaster.ai.
Become a key player in shaping the future of PR with innovative ideas and impactful storytelling that resonate with global audiences.
Primary focus: Direct response (online marketing) copywriting for the B2B SaaS market
Key Responsibilities:Take the lead in crafting high-converting direct response copy tailored to the B2B SaaS audience, including emails, landing pages, ad copy / creatives, and product messaging.Drive all copywriting efforts across digital channels, ensuring every word is optimized for engagement, clarity, and conversion while maintaining brand consistency.Strategize and execute full-funnel digital campaigns‚Äîpaid, organic, and email‚Äîwith compelling copy as the core driver of results.Lead content ideation and messaging strategy in alignment with product positioning, user needs, and market trends within the SaaS space.Collaborate with all departments of a marketing team, such as funnelbuilder, graphic designer, video cutters and product developers to ensure copy and creative work in unison across campaigns.Own and optimize SEO and SEM copy, from metadata and blog headlines to ad variants and performance landing pages.Analyze performance of marketing assets (open rates, CTR, CVR) and iterate copy based on data and testing.Mentor junior writers and content creators, reviewing and refining their work to uphold high standards of clarity, persuasion, and relevance.Recommend innovations in tone, storytelling, or channel strategy to improve user engagement and conversion paths.
Requirements:5‚Äì7 years of hands-on experience in direct response copywriting, with a strong portfolio focused on B2B SaaS, demonstrating measurable results (lead generation, sign-ups, conversions).Native-level English (C2) with the ability to simplify complex SaaS concepts into clear, benefit-driven messaging.Proven ability to lead content-driven digital campaigns across channels like LinkedIn Ads, Google Ads, email sequences, landing pages, and social.Deep understanding of the B2B buyer journey and how to craft copy for different funnel stages (awareness, consideration, decision).Familiarity with SaaS product marketing, value proposition frameworks, and user pain points.Skilled in tools like HubSpot, Marketo, or Pardot, as well as Google Analytics, SEMrush, and WordPress.High stress resilience and the ability to manage tight deadlines and shifting priorities while delivering exceptional results.Strong organizational and communication skills, with a collaborative mindset and attention to detail.Relevant certifications (e.g., Copyhackers, HubSpot Content Marketing, Google Ads) are a plus.
Why you‚Äôll love working with us at Pressmaster.ai?Join a dynamic team dedicated to revolutionizing the PR industry. At Pressmaster.ai, you‚Äôll help shape the future of SaaS and empower businesses worldwide to craft compelling press stories that leave a lasting impact.Thrive in a cutting-edge workspace where creativity, innovation, and AI-powered solutions drive meaningful results.Collaborate closely with seasoned professionals in PR, SaaS, and marketing. Expand your expertise with access to premium training resources and hands-on mentorship opportunities.Work on a variety of high-impact initiatives that challenge your creativity and showcase your skills in the ever-evolving world of PR and tech.We‚Äôre invested in your success. Take advantage of tailored development plans, ongoing training, and a clear path for career advancement.Leverage the latest AI-driven technologies, including our signature all-in-one PR software, to deliver exceptional results effortlessly.Enjoy the freedom of remote work, flexible hours, and a supportive company culture that prioritizes your well-being and work-life balance.We recognize your contributions with a competitive salary, performance bonuses, and comprehensive benefits.
What awaits you at Pressmaster.ai?Experience the ultimate in flexibility. Work remotely, set your own schedule, and enjoy the trust and autonomy to do your best work.Take ownership of your projects, unleash your creativity, and see your ideas transform the PR landscape. At Pressmaster.ai, we welcome innovation and bold solutions.Remote doesn‚Äôt mean disconnected. We value team spirit and foster connection through regular virtual meetings, brainstorming sessions, and social events.Your growth matters to us. Access our curated learning resources, courses, and workshops to continually enhance your skills and expertise.Be part of a vibrant and supportive company culture that values collaboration, celebrates successes, and keeps things fun with engaging virtual activities.Your aspirations drive us. We provide clear paths for growth, helping you achieve your professional goals and unlock new opportunities.Contribute to groundbreaking projects that combine creativity, technology, and PR excellence, all while shaping the future of communication.
Ready to join a passionate team and use your copywriting skills to make a lasting impact in PR and marketing?
Apply now and start your journey with us!

jobs.title: Influencer Marketing Manager
jobs.description:
About usWallester is a cutting-edge financial technology company that specializes in providing innovative solutions for businesses seeking to modernize their payment systems. By offering white-label card issuance platforms, seamless integration with existing infrastructure, and comprehensive support for both digital and physical cards, Wallester empowers companies to enhance their financial services and customer experience. Recognized as a leader in the FinTech space, Wallester has earned a reputation for its state-of-the-art technology, security, and scalability. Whether you are a startup or an established enterprise, Wallester delivers flexible, reliable solutions tailored to meet the evolving needs of the digital economy.
Job DescriptionWe are seeking a strategic and well-connected Influencer Marketing Manager to lead Wallester‚Äôs influencer and thought leadership outreach in the B2B fintech space. In this role, you will identify and collaborate with key voices in fintech, business, finance, and affiliate ecosystems to increase brand authority, visibility, and demand generation through trusted third-party promotion.
Key ResponsibilitiesDevelop and execute an influencer marketing strategy tailored to B2B finance/fintech audiences (e.g. startups, CFOs, affiliate partners, neobanks, payment platforms).This includes collaborations with our core client segments such as media buying agencies, e-commerce businesses, travel agencies, and other relevant verticals.Identify and engage with relevant industry influencers, such as fintech bloggers, Instagram, Facebook, LinkedIn thought leaders, podcast hosts, and event speakers.Build and maintain strong, long-term relationships with external creators and KOLs (key opinion leaders).Collaborate with internal teams (content, performance, affiliate) to align messaging and campaigns.Manage contract negotiations, briefing, and content approval processes.Track and report on influencer campaign performance, with a focus on brand awareness, lead quality, and engagement.Own Wallester‚Äôs influencer CRM, campaign calendar, and performance dashboard.
RequirementsMust-Have:2‚Äì4 years of experience in influencer marketing, partnerships, or B2B marketing.Strong knowledge of YouTube, followed by META platforms, LinkedIn, Twitter/X and fintech media ecosystems.Proven ability to identify and collaborate with influencers and thought leaders in B2B environments.Excellent communication, negotiation, and stakeholder management skills.Strategic mindset with understanding of how influencer campaigns support business goals like lead generation, partner acquisition, and brand trust.Proficiency with tracking tools, UTM tagging, and influencer platforms (e.g., Upfluence, BuzzSumo, or manual CRM).Languages: Fluent English is required. Proficiency in Russian, Spanish, French, or German is a plus.Nice-to-Have:Experience in fintech, SaaS, or financial services.Existing network of fintech content creators and/or affiliate experts.Experience with multi-language or multi-market campaigns in Europe.Knowledge of financial regulations for promotional content, such as disclosure requirements.
Company offers:Competitive salaryCareer opportunitiesSupportive and caring LeadershipA chance to work as part of a highly motivated and talented teamTeam building and Company Events

jobs.title: Community & Growth Manager (Remote - EMEA)
jobs.description:
Commitment: Full-time

Start Date: Immediate

Jobgether is reinventing job search for the remote-first world. Our AI-powered platform connects global talent with remote opportunities, helping people find meaningful work through better job matching and career coaching.

We're looking for a Community & Growth Manager to grow and engage our global community of job seekers.

Your mission: raise awareness of Jobgether worldwide by building active communities across social media, forums, and content channels, while also activating and engaging our existing user base.

This role is about experimentation and execution: trying new growth hacks, testing ideas, and finding what drives adoption and engagement.

Your mission

Implement and execute the go-to-market strategy for community growthExpand Jobgether's presence across Reddit, LinkedIn, X, and other channelsDesign and run content marketing campaigns (posts, threads, newsletters, replies) to attract job seekers globallyActivate and engage our existing users through email campaigns, Discord engagement, and in-product messagingExplore and test growth hacking tactics to drive visibility and adoptionIdentify and nurture communities where job seekers gatherTrack performance, analyze results, and iterate fast


Requirements

2+ years of experience in community building, growth, or content marketing (startup / B2C SaaS background)Fluent in English is a must; Spanish or French as a second language is a plusStartup mindset: creative, hands-on, action-oriented, fully accountablePassion for exploring and testing new ideas (growth hacking mentality)Strong communication skills and ability to engage across multiple channels (social, email, Discord, forums)Comfortable working remotely, autonomously, and at a fast pace 


Benefits

Shape the growth of a product with real social impactFully remote, async, and flexible; work from anywhere in EMEA or LATAMWork directly with founders and core teamFlat hierarchy, fast decision-making, and freedom to experimentBe part of an early-stage startup where your impact is visible every day

jobs.title: Freelance SEO Expert
jobs.description:
An SEO specialist is required to optimize a new website for a health and wellness provider in Austin, Texas. The website, currently in development and set to launch within the next month, needs to be search-engine ready from the outset. The focus will be on building a strong SEO foundation during the development phase, followed by ongoing optimization and strategy to grow online visibility and attract new clients. This is a remote position suited for a professional who can deliver both technical SEO setup and long-term performance improvements.
DeliverablesConduct keyword research tailored to manual lymphatic drainage services and the Austin, Texas market.Provide SEO guidance during the site‚Äôs development to ensure proper on-page and technical setup.Optimize meta tags, headings, alt text, and site architecture for maximum search performance.Implement local SEO strategies to enhance visibility within Austin and surrounding areas.Support setup of Google Analytics, Google Search Console, and other tracking tools.Deliver an SEO roadmap and best practices guide for launch readiness.Provide ongoing SEO support post-launch, including monitoring, reporting, and continuous optimization.
RequirementsDemonstrated experience in SEO, particularly for service-based local businesses.Strong understanding of on-page, technical, and off-page SEO strategies.Proven ability to optimize websites during the build phase to avoid post-launch issues.Familiarity with local SEO practices, including Google Business Profile optimization.Proficiency with SEO tools such as SEMrush, Ahrefs, Moz, or Screaming Frog.Experience with WordPress or other CMS platforms is highly desirable.Strong communication skills to provide clear recommendations and updates.Availability to collaborate remotely and provide continued support after site launch.
About TwineTwine is a leading freelance marketplace connecting top freelancers, consultants, and contractors with companies needing creative and tech expertise. Trusted by Fortune 500 companies and innovative startups alike, Twine enables companies to scale their teams globally.
Our MissionTwine's mission is to empower creators and businesses to thrive in an AI-driven, freelance-first world.

jobs.title: Wallet Operations Team Lead
jobs.description:
Job title: Wallet Operations - Team Lead

Location: Paris, France

About Ledger

We‚Äôre a team of experts pushing the limits of what‚Äôs possible, united by our common goal to unlock true freedom through digital ownership, making technology accessible for all. We believe in a world where users, creators and enterprises manage their value with ownership and freedom. Our curiosity drives us to innovate, empowering individuals on a global scale. We believe change is constant and our team moves forward as one, with a culture of problem-solving where every employee is empowered and supported to challenge tradition and create solutions. Our mission is simple: to make self-custody accessible and give people the keys to their own financial futures. If you want to make a true impact, we want you to join us at Ledger.

At Ledger, we‚Äôre proud to be the global platform for digital assets and Web3, with over 20% of the world‚Äôs crypto assets secured through our Ledger devices. With our headquarters in Paris, and offices in Vierzon, Grenoble, Montpellier, London, Portland, Geneva, Zurich and Central Singapore, we have a team of around 600 professionals developing a variety of products and services to enable individuals and companies to securely buy, store, swap, grow and manage crypto assets ‚Äì including the Ledger hardware wallets line with more than 7.5 millions units already sold in 200 countries.

The Team

We are seeking a dynamic and highly motivated leader to lead our Wallet Operations team.

The Wallet Operations and Optimization Team is responsible for looking at the ongoing performance and experience quality of the Ledger Wallet (the application itself and its services) from the point of view of the end Consumer and the point of View of the Providers delivering the Ledger Wallet services. In order to complete this task, the team will build, observe and monitor a broad set of internal, external and customer related indicators, KPIs and dashboards as well as directly observe the Wallet experience. Based on procedures the team will look for and investigate potential issues, alert, when relevant directly remedy some situations especially partner related, as well as reach out to other internal groups and external partners in order for them to take action. The team is equally a resource for other teams in order to clarify issues and take actions within their remit.

The team will actively contribute to delivering the best possible consumer and partner experience of the current version of the Wallet, contribute to identifying optimisation and ultimately impact consumers and partners satisfaction, engagement, NPS, and Ledger revenue.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing

The Team Lead will be a key part of building the above set-up, scaling, optimizing it and forming and leading the team.

What We‚Äôre Looking For

Material experience in setting up new operational functions preferably within a B2B or B2C environment.Demonstrated experience (2+ years) in Cryptocurrency Wallet Operations or a similar operational role, and 5+ years in a management positionStrong negotiation skills with a proven ability to build and maintain B2B2C relationships with partners and stakeholders within the cryptocurrency ecosystemExperience assimilating data, from a variety of monitoring and alerting tools (e.g. Datadog, Tableau, Mixpanel).Experience operating effectively in a matrix environment, ensuring collaboration across diverse teams.Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills and the ability to work under pressure.Effective communication skills, both written and verbal, with a "Customer-First" attitude.Proven ability to write clear, concise process documentation, governance frameworks, and operational playbooks.


Bonus Points

Familiarity with industry-standard monitoring tools and software.Experience with ITIL or other incident management frameworks


Benefits

At Ledger, we are dedicated to continually investing in our employees which is why we offer more than just salaries; we provide comprehensive compensation packages that include a wide range of benefits. Here are some of the benefits you can look forward to:

Flexible work options - Our hybrid policy allows employees to work from home up to 3 times per weekHealth & Wellness support - Health and Life Insurance.Financial growth opportunities - Employees can become shareholders in Ledger as well as other financial benefits depending on your country of work.Commuter allowance - Ledger offers a commuter allowance to contribute to your preferred means of transportation.Learning & Development - A comprehensive suite of training solutions providing a personalised learning experience for every employee.


For regionally specific benefits, your Talent Acquisition contact will be able to provide you with more information.

We‚Äôre committed to building an inclusive hiring process. If you need any adjustments or accommodations, just let us know, we‚Äôll do our best to support you.

description.text:
Job title: Wallet Operations - Team Lead

Location: Paris, France

About Ledger

We‚Äôre a team of experts pushing the limits of what‚Äôs possible, united by our common goal to unlock true freedom through digital ownership, making technology accessible for all. We believe in a world where users, creators and enterprises manage their value with ownership and freedom. Our curiosity drives us to innovate, empowering individuals on a global scale. We believe change is constant and our team moves forward as one, with a culture of problem-solving where every employee is empowered and supported to challenge tradition and create solutions. Our mission is simple: to make self-custody accessible and give people the keys to their own financial futures. If you want to make a true impact, we want you to join us at Ledger.

At Ledger, we‚Äôre proud to be the global platform for digital assets and Web3, with over 20% of the world‚Äôs crypto assets secured through our Ledger devices. With our headquarters in Paris, and offices in Vierzon, Grenoble, Montpellier, London, Portland, Geneva, Zurich and Central Singapore, we have a team of around 600 professionals developing a variety of products and services to enable individuals and companies to securely buy, store, swap, grow and manage crypto assets ‚Äì including the Ledger hardware wallets line with more than 7.5 millions units already sold in 200 countries.

The Team

We are seeking a dynamic and highly motivated leader to lead our Wallet Operations team.

The Wallet Operations and Optimization Team is responsible for looking at the ongoing performance and experience quality of the Ledger Wallet (the application itself and its services) from the point of view of the end Consumer and the point of View of the Providers delivering the Ledger Wallet services. In order to complete this task, the team will build, observe and monitor a broad set of internal, external and customer related indicators, KPIs and dashboards as well as directly observe the Wallet experience. Based on procedures the team will look for and investigate potential issues, alert, when relevant directly remedy some situations especially partner related, as well as reach out to other internal groups and external partners in order for them to take action. The team is equally a resource for other teams in order to clarify issues and take actions within their remit.

The team will actively contribute to delivering the best possible consumer and partner experience of the current version of the Wallet, contribute to identifying optimisation and ultimately impact consumers and partners satisfaction, engagement, NPS, and Ledger revenue.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing

The Team Lead will be a key part of building the above set-up, scaling, optimizing it and forming and leading the team.

What We‚Äôre Looking For

Material experience in setting up new operational functions preferably within a B2B or B2C environment.Demonstrated experience (2+ years) in Cryptocurrency Wallet Operations or a similar operational role, and 5+ years in a management positionStrong negotiation skills with a proven ability to build and maintain B2B2C relationships with partners and stakeholders within the cryptocurrency ecosystemExperience assimilating data, from a variety of monitoring and alerting tools (e.g. Datadog, Tableau, Mixpanel).Experience operating effectively in a matrix environment, ensuring collaboration across diverse teams.Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills and the ability to work under pressure.Effective communication skills, both written and verbal, with a "Customer-First" attitude.Proven ability to write clear, concise process documentation, governance frameworks, and operational playbooks.


Bonus Points

Familiarity with industry-standard monitoring tools and software.Experience with ITIL or other incident management frameworks


Benefits

At Ledger, we are dedicated to continually investing in our employees which is why we offer more than just salaries; we provide comprehensive compensation packages that include a wide range of benefits. Here are some of the benefits you can look forward to:

Flexible work options - Our hybrid policy allows employees to work from home up to 3 times per weekHealth & Wellness support - Health and Life Insurance.Financial growth opportunities - Employees can become shareholders in Ledger as well as other financial benefits depending on your country of work.Commuter allowance - Ledger offers a commuter allowance to contribute to your preferred means of transportation.Learning & Development - A comprehensive suite of training solutions providing a personalised learning experience for every employee.


For regionally specific benefits, your Talent Acquisition contact will be able to provide you with more information.

We‚Äôre committed to building an inclusive hiring process. If you need any adjustments or accommodations, just let us know, we‚Äôll do our best to support you.

jobs.title: Executive Content Creator
jobs.description:
We‚Äôre looking for an Executive Content Creator to help supercharge the voice of Plytix‚Äôs CEO across digital channels. This role is part researcher, part ghostwriter, and part content strategist. You‚Äôll be working directly with the CEO to turn raw insights, notes, and ideas into polished content for X, Substack, and LinkedIn. From fact-checking trends to shaping narratives to managing the publishing process, you‚Äôll make sure the CEO‚Äôs voice is sharp, consistent, and influential.
What is Plytix?
Plytix is the world‚Äôs leading Product Information Management (PIM) platform for small and medium-sized businesses (SMBs). Plytix PIM helps companies store and organize product information ranging from descriptions and images to prices, and other specifications, in one place. Essentially, it‚Äôs a handy tool that makes managing and updating product data a whole lot easier.
About our culture
We‚Äôre not big on corporate jargon, so we‚Äôll keep it real. We‚Äôre a diverse team spread across the world, working together to build great software while enjoying the ride. We‚Äôve been recognized as one of the best places to work in Spain by Great Place to Work¬Æ - 3 years in a row, but who‚Äôs counting ;)
Plytix is no typical company, watch this video, and if you like what you see, keep scrolling.
What‚Äôs the opportunity?
This is your chance to work side-by-side with a founder-CEO who‚Äôs building thought leadership in ecommerce, SaaS, and AI. You‚Äôll have a front-row seat to the conversations, insights, and predictions shaping the future of these industries‚Äîand you‚Äôll be the one turning those into engaging content that reaches thousands of readers and followers globally.
From research-driven Substack articles to bite-sized X threads and sharp LinkedIn posts, you‚Äôll help amplify the CEO‚Äôs voice and build his reputation as a thought leader. If you‚Äôre someone who loves storytelling, thrives on digging into new ideas, and can balance creativity with precision, this role gives you the perfect mix of autonomy, creativity, and impact.

What will you be doing?
Researching and fact-checking industry trends, news, and insights to support the CEO‚Äôs content.Ghostwriting articles, posts, and threads in the CEO‚Äôs voice for Substack, LinkedIn, and X.Managing the editorial calendar for the CEO‚Äôs content channels.Collaborating with the CEO to brainstorm and refine narratives and storylines.Publishing, monitoring, and iterating content to grow reach and engagement.Ensuring consistency of tone, accuracy of information, and alignment with Plytix‚Äôs brand values.

After 1 month:You‚Äôll have a strong grasp of the CEO‚Äôs tone of voice, favorite topics, and how he likes to communicate. You‚Äôll have already supported in drafting and publishing a few LinkedIn or X posts, and you‚Äôll have a content calendar mapped out.
After 3 months:You‚Äôll be confidently ghostwriting and publishing across multiple channels. The CEO‚Äôs content will start showing measurable growth in reach and engagement. You‚Äôll be known internally as the right hand for anything related to CEO thought leadership.
6 months in:You‚Äôll have fully taken ownership of the CEO‚Äôs content ecosystem. The Substack will be running smoothly with consistent articles, social channels will be growing steadily, and the CEO‚Äôs voice will be a recognizable one in SaaS and ecommerce circles. By this point, you won‚Äôt just be producing content‚Äîyou‚Äôll be shaping a thought leadership brand.
Who will you be working with?
You‚Äôll work directly with the CEO, collaborating closely on ideas and narratives. You‚Äôll also interact with the Marketing team to align messaging and ensure the CEO‚Äôs voice complements Plytix‚Äôs broader brand strategy.
Need to have:
5+ years of experience in content writing, journalism, ghostwriting, or copywriting.Exceptional English writing and editing skills.Ability to adapt tone of voice and write as if you are the CEO.Strong research and fact-checking skills.Experience managing and publishing on platforms like Substack, LinkedIn, and X.A portfolio showing long-form and short-form content across digital platforms.
Nice to have
Background in B2B SaaS, ecommerce, or retail.Experience working directly with executives or founders on personal branding.Knowledge of SEO and content analytics.A natural curiosity for AI, SaaS, and the future of commerce.A dog üê∂ (dogs are the best).
To apply:
Easy apply on LinkedIn and send us your video presentation via email to hr@plytix.comVideo presentation: for an explanation of the video requirement see this video üëâüèº https://youtu.be/XgLelH6eIkc?si=p94LmMtktZOirsuH

Why work at Plytix
Voted one of the top best workplaces by Great Place to Work¬ÆBe a part of a welcoming culture with bright, friendly people from around the worldHave a purpose and plenty of opportunities to grow from day oneWork from home or from our offices in the center of MalagaDon‚Äôt work on your birthday‚Äîenjoy an extra day of paid time offEnjoy free catered lunches and unlimited ice cream when working from the office in MalagaCompetitive full-time salaryPrivate health insurance covered by PlytixGym discountFactorial Flexible Retribution (Restaurant, Transport & Nursery Vouchers)And more!

About our culture
PLYTIX is a company committed to diversity and equality. Therefore, all our selection processes guarantee equal opportunities for all candidates regardless of race, color, religion, sex, origin, nationality, age, disability, sexual orientation, and gender identity. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements, merit, and individual qualifications.
We are committed to managing your personal information with care and in accordance with our privacy policy. To learn more about how we handle your data, please click HERE.
